channel.title: No spawning in wilderness help please
channel.description: How would i add this. ?? Thanks .

item.title: No spawning in wilderness help please
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“usman555, post:24, topic:403668”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=500734.msg3662864#msg3662864 date=1310441683]

That wouldn’t work, because you have no try statement. Correct me if I’m wrong though.

Judging by the context of the command, all the commands are in one try-catch. Something like

try {
    // 999 commands here
}
catch (Exception e) {

}

I personally don’t like this format, because you lose the ability to do different things for different exceptions. The only way to fix that is to put a try-catch inside the larger try-catch.
[/quote]Why? After all the coding, you could put exceptions for everything. Catch or finally/final (I forgot), and else for the other exceptions.[/quote]

Yes you could do

try {
    // stuff
}
catch (NumberFormatException nfe) {
    // more stuff
}
catch (IOException ioe) {
    // more stuff
}
catch (Exception ex) {
    // more stuff
}

But perhaps you have more than one command that can throw the exception. Let’s say, teleporting and spawning an item. Both take numbers as arguments, but if the command is entered incorrectly, it should spit out different responses. For example

try {
    // 999 commands
}
catch (NumberFormatException nfe) {
    player.sendMessage("Invalid syntax: ::tele x y[ z]");
}

If the player enters the pickup command and enters the number wrong, it will still tell them that the syntax is “::tele x y[ z]”. Where as something like this

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("tele")) {
    if (args.length < 3 || args.length > 4) {
        return;
    }
    try {
        final int x = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
        final int y = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
        final int z = (args.length == 4) ? Integer.parseInt(args[3]) : 0;
        player.setLocation(x, y, z);
    }
    catch (final NumberFormatException ex) {
        player.sendMessage("Invalid syntax; use: ::tele x y[ z]");
    }
}
else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("item")) {
    if (args.length != 3) {
        return;
    }
    try {
        final int id = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
        final int amount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
        final Item item = new Item(id, amount);
        player.getInventory().add(item)
    }
    catch (final NumberFormatException ex) {
        player.sendMessage("Invalid syntax; use: ::item id amount");
    }

tells the player exactly what was wrong with the command, and is unique to each command.

Read full topic
item.source: No spawning in wilderness help please

I personally don’t like this format, because you lose the ability to do different things for different exceptions. Judging by the context of the command, all the commands are in one try-catch. Something like

item.title: No spawning in wilderness help please
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“usman555, post:20, topic:403668”][quote author=4markie link=topic=500734.msg3662797#msg3662797 date=1310439359]

Wow, you guys can’t do ANYTHING.

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 1 && !isInWilderness(absX, absY, 0)) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("No such item."); } } else { sendMessage("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100"); } }

Basically what I just posted a few posts above. How the hell am I supposed to know the name of his boolean for wilderness?

Your welcome btw.
[/quote]KK, if you plan on staying in MoparScape, then you better get used to flaming spam and criticism.[/quote]

That doesn’t let the player know that it can’t be used in the wilderness. It might as well be

            if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 1 && !isInWilderness(absX, absY, 0) && args.length == 3) {
                        String[] args = command.split(" ");
                        int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
                        int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
                        if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) {
                                addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
                        }
            }

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @4markie 4markie
item.description:
@4markie wrote:

BubbleScape x:

I get a lot of cannot find symbols if i declare that in player.java

My bad, use this instead

public boolean inWild() {
                if(absX > 2941 && absX < 3392 && absY > 3518 && absY < 3966 ||
                        absX > 2941 && absX < 3392 && absY > 9918 && absY < 10366){        
                        return true;
                }
                return false;
        }

item.title: No spawning in wilderness help please
item.dc:creator: @4markie 4markie
item.description:
@4markie wrote:

BubbleScape x:

I get a cannot find symbol on IsInWilderness. It is not declared already in my client, i have been trying to but all errors, can you help me declare it? its declared in player.java, though.

Add this in player.java

[code]public boolean inWild() {
	if(isInFala() || isInArd() || isInPvP() || freeAtk || inFunPK()) {
	return true;
	}
	if(absX > 2941 && absX < 3392 && absY > 3518 && absY < 3966 ||
		absX > 2941 && absX < 3392 && absY > 9918 && absY < 10366){ 	
		return true;
	}
	return false;
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: No spawning in wilderness help please
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“BubbleScape x, post:9, topic:403668”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=500734.msg3662767#msg3662767 date=1310437608]

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 1) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("No such item."); } } else { sendMessage("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100"); } }

You might want to put in exception handling (if it’s not in there already).
[/quote]Im not so good at this. Spoon feed please.?[/quote]

No spoonfeed. The only reason I said that is Integer.parseInt throws a NumberFormatException. Judging from the context, the logic processing is already inside a try-catch, so there’s nothing to worry about.

Anyways, all you would have to do is add the code I posted (edited of course for your server) before you process the command.

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 1) {
    // HERE
    String[] args = command.split(" ");
    if(args.length == 3) {
        int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
        int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
        if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) {
            addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
        }
        else {
            sendMessage("No such item.");
        }
    } else {
        sendMessage("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100");
    }
}

Read full topic

item.title: No spawning in wilderness help please
item.dc:creator: @4markie 4markie
item.description:
@4markie wrote:

[quote=“BubbleScape x, post:9, topic:403668”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=500734.msg3662767#msg3662767 date=1310437608]

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 1) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("No such item."); } } else { sendMessage("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100"); } }

You might want to put in exception handling (if it’s not in there already).
[/quote]Im not so good at this. Spoon feed please.?[/quote]

Replace your current command with this one:

            if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 1 && !inWild()) {
                        String[] args = command.split(" ");
                 if(args.length == 3) {
                        int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
                        int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
                        if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) {
                                addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
                        } else {
                                sendMessage("No such item.");
                        }
                } else {
                        sendMessage("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100");
                }
            }

You may get an error, as I don’t know what your wilderness boolean is exactly called.

Read full topic

item.title: No spawning in wilderness help please
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:2, topic:403668”][code] if (playerCommand.startsWith(“item”)) {
try {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
if (args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
if(c.inWild())
return;
c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
c.sendMessage(“That item ID does not exist.”);
}
} else {
c.sendMessage(“Wrong usage: (Ex:(::pickup_ID_Amount)(::item 995 1))”);
}
} catch(Exception e) {

			} // HERE?
			} // HERE?[/code]

try that. prob didnt add it in the right spot though[/quote]

That does absolutely nothing.

Add a check if the player is in the wilderness before any processing is done.

if (command.equals("item")) {
    if (player.isInWilderness()) {
        player.sendMessage("You cannot spawn in the wilderness.");
        return;
    }
    // Normal processing
}

Read full topic
